meanings.definition: To appoint or elect into a group or organization
meanings.sent1: She coopted her friend to join the school club.
meanings.sent2: The committee coopted a new member to help with the project.
meanings.sent3: He coopted his sister to play a game with him.
meanings.sent4: The team coopted a strategy from their opponents.
meanings.sent5: The teacher coopted a fun activity for the class.

meanings.definition: To take over or adopt something for one's own use
meanings.sent1: The company coopted a new technology to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The artist coopted a unique style for her paintings.
meanings.sent3: He coopted his brother's idea for the school project.
meanings.sent4: The chef coopted a recipe from a famous cookbook.
meanings.sent5: The student coopted a study method that helped him succeed.

meanings.definition: To win over or persuade someone to join a cause or group
meanings.sent1: She coopted her classmates to participate in the charity event.
meanings.sent2: The leader coopted more supporters for the campaign.
meanings.sent3: He coopted his friend to help him with the school project.
meanings.sent4: The organization coopted volunteers to assist in the event.
meanings.sent5: The team coopted new members to strengthen their group.
